intro: Silene nuda subsp. typica, commonly known as the naked stork's bill, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its simple, leafless stems and showy, pink to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as roadsides and meadows. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Silene nuda subsp. typica is often found in moist, sandy soils and is adapted to temperate climates.
